title: Build Interactive Agent Script Navigator

requirements.text: Create a frontend interface that displays the Verisure retention script as an interactive decision tree with clickable navigation buttons for agents to follow conversation paths

quotes: maak een script waar agents kunnen klikken en dan gelijk weten wat ze moeten zeggen

acceptanceCriteria: Agents can click through the script structure from start to end
Navigation buttons clearly show available customer response options
Current position in the conversation flow is visually indicated

requirements.text: Implement the initial diagnosis screen that presents the main question 'Waarin zijn we u tekortgekomen? Gaat het om het financiÃ«le aspect, bent u ergens ontevreden over, of gebruikt u het systeem simpelweg niet?' with three clickable options: FINA (Financial), UNHAPPY (Dissatisfied), and NO USE (No usage)
acceptanceCriteria: Main diagnosis question is displayed prominently at the start
Three primary category buttons are clearly labeled and clickable
Clicking a category navigates to the corresponding refinement screen

requirements.text: Build the FINA (Financial) branch with refinement question 'Mag ik u vragen: vindt u het bedrag de investering niet meer waard, kiest u ervoor om uw prioriteiten anders te leggen, of zit u in een situatie waarin elke euro echt telt?' and three subcategory paths: Waarde mismatch (Value mismatch), Prioriteitsconflict (Priority conflict), and FinanciÃ«le nood (Financial hardship)
acceptanceCriteria: Financial refinement question displays when FINA is selected
Three subcategory buttons navigate to detailed script sections
Back navigation allows return to main diagnosis

requirements.text: Implement detailed script view for Waarde mismatch (1.1) showing diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, complete solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the script
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections (diagnosis, 3 questions, reframing, solution, closing) are displayed
Text is presented in readable format with proper spacing
Agent can copy text or navigate to other scenarios

requirements.text: Implement detailed script view for Prioriteitsconflict (1.2) showing diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, complete solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the script
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections are displayed with proper formatting
Content matches the provided Priority conflict scenario exactly
Navigation allows movement between scenarios

requirements.text: Implement detailed script view for FinanciÃ«le nood (1.3) showing diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, complete solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the script
acceptanceCriteria: All script sections are displayed accurately
Financial hardship scenario content is complete
Agent can navigate between all financial subcategories

requirements.text: Build the UNHAPPY (Dissatisfied) branch with refinement question 'Waar bent u precies ontevreden over: de prijs, onze service of het systeem zelf?' and three subcategory paths: PRICE, SERVICE, and SYSTEEM
acceptanceCriteria: Unhappy refinement question displays when UNHAPPY is selected
Three subcategory buttons for Price, Service, and System are available
Navigation flows correctly from main diagnosis to subcategories

requirements.text: Implement detailed script views for all three UNHAPPY subcategories (2.1 PRICE, 2.2 SERVICE, 2.3 SYSTEEM) each showing diagnosis question, three qualifying questions, reframing points, complete solution text, and closing question exactly as provided in the script
acceptanceCriteria: All three Unhappy scenarios display complete script content
Text formatting preserves structure of diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, and closing
Agent can navigate between Price, Service, and System scenarios

requirements.text: Build the NO USE (No usage) branch with refinement question 'Gebruikt u het systeem niet omdat uw situatie is veranderd, omdat u zelf maatregelen heeft genomen, of omdat het eigenlijk niet uw intentie was?' and three main category paths: Situatie is veranderd (Situation changed), Zelf maatregelen genomen (Self-measures taken), and Niet mijn intentie (Not my intention)
acceptanceCriteria: No Use refinement question displays when NO USE is selected
Three main category buttons navigate to their respective subcategories
Navigation structure supports the deeper hierarchy of this branch

requirements.text: Implement the Situatie is veranderd (Situation changed) subsection with diagnosis question leading to three further subcategories: Ik ben vaker thuis (1.1), Er gebeurt hier nooit wat (1.2), and De dreiging is weg (1.3), each with complete script content including diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, and closing question
acceptanceCriteria: Situation changed category displays diagnosis question with three subcategory options
All three subcategories show complete script content
Multi-level navigation works correctly within the NO USE branch

requirements.text: Implement the Zelf maatregelen genomen (Self-measures taken) subsection with diagnosis question leading to three subcategories: Hond (2.1), Camera (2.2), and Rolluiken / Hekwerk / Hang- en sluitwerk (2.3), each with complete script content including diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, and closing question
acceptanceCriteria: Self-measures category displays diagnosis question with three subcategory options
Dog, Camera, and Security measures subcategories each show complete scripts
Navigation supports moving between all self-measures scenarios

requirements.text: Implement the Niet mijn intentie (Not my intention) subsection with diagnosis question leading to three subcategories: Agressieve verkoop (3.1), Partner heeft het aangeschaft (3.2), and Nieuwe woning / beginfase (3.3), each with complete script content including diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, and closing question
acceptanceCriteria: Not my intention category displays diagnosis question with three subcategory options
Aggressive sales, Partner purchased, and New home subcategories show complete scripts
All NO USE subcategories are accessible and navigable

requirements.text: Add a breadcrumb navigation system that shows the current path through the script hierarchy (e.g., START > NO USE > Situation Changed > More Often Home) and allows clicking to navigate back to any level
acceptanceCriteria: Breadcrumb trail is visible at all levels of the script
Each breadcrumb level is clickable and navigates to that section
Current position is clearly indicated in the breadcrumb

requirements.text: Display all Dutch text content exactly as provided in the script, preserving formatting, quotes, bullet points, and special characters throughout the interface
acceptanceCriteria: All script text appears in Dutch as provided
Formatting matches the original structure
No text is truncated or altered

requirements.text: Implement a clear visual design that distinguishes between different script sections (diagnosis, questions, reframing, solution, closing) using typography, spacing, or subtle background colors to improve readability for agents during live calls
acceptanceCriteria: Script sections are visually distinct and easy to scan
Design supports quick reading during calls
Interface feels professional and calm, suitable for customer service context

constraints: All script text must be displayed in Dutch exactly as provided
Navigation must support the hierarchical structure with up to 4 levels deep (START > Main Category > Subcategory > Sub-subcategory)
Interface must be optimized for quick scanning during live customer calls
nonGoals: Editing or customizing the script content
